comments:
I accidently reported this bug in the EclisepME web site. It is CLOSED there and the response was to post it in the proper place. I hope this is the proper place this time. I will ONLY place it in ONE place at a time until it is resolved.

First let me say kudos for a phenomenal product! I've used it anywhere from 8 to 23 hours a day for a couple of years now.

I've moved to the latest version of Eclipse BECAUSE this exact bug showed up in a previous version. I've checked to make sure I'm up to the latest patches on everything as well. Fairly vanilla install - only probable issueI see is that I have a LOT of code in the editor.

If I do the dot (.) and then CTRL-Space I sometimes get "suggestions" in java code. I can't just do CTRL-Space on a blank line and I can't do CTRL-Space on a partially typed class or method name or variable etc. Nothing happens???

Help! I can't live without the CTRL-Space feature much longer!!!

I've done the obvious restarts, reboots and complete Project cleans. Problem persists. I seems to be a timing issue during startup so I've even tried starting Eclipse and walking away from the machine for 30 minutes before touching a single key.

I can *work* (like a three legged dog can walk) and everything else appears functional. Compiles, debugging etc.

Attached are some errors from the Log that started appearing around the time this problem manifested. Yes it has gone away briefly in the past but currently seems to be here for good.

MAY be related to using Java 1.6 on the desktop HOWEVER system worked fine for several months on this exact version of Java before issue appeared.

java version "1.6.0_02"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_02-b06)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.6.0_02-b06, mixed mode, sharing)

If you need any other details please contact me. PC is running WinXP Pro (fully patched) and has 2 Gigs of RAM, Dual XEON procs and 6 monitors...

Gary: the warnings look like a duplicate of bug 188524 and should be innocuous.  Could you please take a look at the following FAQ entry and see if it addresses your problem?

http://wiki.eclipse.org/Mylyn_FAQ#Content_assist_troubleshooting
(In reply to comment #1)
> Gary: the warnings look like a duplicate of bug 188524 and should be innocuous.
>  Could you please take a look at the following FAQ entry and see if it
> addresses your problem?
> 
> http://wiki.eclipse.org/Mylyn_FAQ#Content_assist_troubleshooting
> 

Although it looks similar I do not believe this is the bug reported as 188524.

As for a possible configuration issue the problem did not start with any configuration changes. I started getting these errors one day and my Content Assist stopped working at that point.

The situation deteriorated badly yesterday. I hit the dreaded PermGen brick wall and started getting OutOfMemory crashes growing in frequency to 5 minute intervals. That was AFTER making the PermGen space 512M and the VM 1024M (yes I have more then enough RAM to do this). 

I bailed at that point and downloaded a clean install of 3.3.1 (Eclispe Classic). I've added only the Web Tools and MyLyn to this download. I do need to get EclispeME functional as well in this same workbench area however that is not installed yet.

I have the old workbench and the 3.3 install set aside if anyone feels like doing any postmortem work.

3.3.1 crashed this morning with a PermGen error and now I've upped the settings in it via eclipse.ini. Again 512M PermGen space and 1024M for the JVM. Let me know just how stupid those numbers are...

Amusingly even though I've RESET to the standard defaults for the MyLYN configuration I still do not have a fully functional Content Assist working yet.

Next step would be to build a clean workbench and basically build the entire setup from scratch. 

I can live with what I have now as long as it does not crash again (I have a sick feeling it will however). You may close this bug if you like and I'll create another one if the crashing continues.

!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space

Root cause of original CTRL-Space (Context Assist) issue has now been isolated.

<SIGH> 

Turns out that Eclipse and the Optimus Mini Three keyboard (if you can call it that) are not compatible. The Optimus unit's drivers was stealing keystrokes (in spite of the unit itself no longer being installed). 

http://www.artlebedev.com/everything/optimus-mini/ 

What is a unit like this doing on a development machine? Client wants us to look at using it for a new program. 

In any case I have CTRL-Space working again and I can breath a sigh of relief. 

However whether or not this is related to the PermGen and Workbench crashes or not is only going to be determined by the passage of time.





Wow, very interesting and weird problem.  We can continue the PermGen discussion further on bug 206236.
